<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/22/spotify-joins-rest-media-world-focusing-international-expansion?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Global Content Is King
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="International media " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MTQxL2ludGVybmF0aW9uYWxfbWVkaWEuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday at its Stream On event, Spotify said it was launching its service in <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2021/02/22/spotify-to-expand-international-footprint-across-85-new-markets/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">85 new markets</a> across Asia, Africa, the Caribbean, and beyond. Already the dominant audio player with 340 million active users, the expansion will nearly double Spotify’s global footprint. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>With Hollywood and NYC churning out cultural hit after cultural hit, the US has historically dominated the music and entertainment industries. But the growing success of international content shows the center of gravity is shifting.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Some examples:</strong></span><span> Puerto Rican star Bad Bunny was the most streamed artist on Spotify last year, the French Netflix show </span><span><em>Lupin </em></span><span>was watched by over 70 million people, and South Korean film </span><span><em>Parasite </em></span><span>became the first-ever foreign language film to win Best Picture at the Oscars. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Businesses are looking for new eyes and ears</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Spotify, which has headquarters in Sweden and the US, joins American media companies in recalibrating growth plans to place a larger emphasis on international markets.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Netflix has invested in international content to differentiate itself in the streaming wars, maintain an upward growth trajectory, and serve something fresh to its American viewers. It’s succeeding on <a href="https://www.axios.com/americans-consuming-foreign-entertainment-content-8b793e14-f493-4c13-ba4f-e4bddd7a96e1.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">all fronts</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In Q4 of last year, 7.7 million of Netflix's 8.5 million new subscribers came from international markets. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And in Q3, non-US shows across all streaming services accounted for nearly 30% of demand in the US, according to data provided to Axios from Parrot Analytics.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Spotify has been slower to expand outside the US and Europe because securing music rights is a huge headache, but now it's going all-in on the Netflix model. Yesterday's expansion opened its service up to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-22/spotify-expands-to-80-new-markets-targeting-1-billion-customers?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">1 billion more people</a>, which will help power discoverability for new artists, styles, and genres. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"All this untapped music energy and access to our innovative creator tools will help propel artists to new heights," Spotify wrote in a statement. Put another way, a more global user base will help New Music Friday surface the </span><span><em>Lupin</em></span><span>s of the music world. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Streaming companies' efforts to expand internationally mirror the mostly borderless world of social media, where creators on platforms like TikTok can achieve global fame with a single viral video. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LEGAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/22/trump-taxes-supreme-court-allows-manhattan-da-subpoena-financial-documents?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Supreme Court Trumps Trump
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/22/trump-taxes-supreme-court-allows-manhattan-da-subpoena-financial-documents" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Documents in a folder with Trump Organization insignia" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNjc0L3RydW1wX29yZ19kb2N1bWVudHMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the nation's highest court <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2021/02/22/supreme-court-donald-trump-tax-returns-new-york-470826?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blocked</a> former President Trump from keeping his financial records out of the hands of Manhattan District Attorney Cyrus Vance Jr. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The details of Vance's investigation into alleged tax, insurance, and bank fraud by the Trump Organization (which includes residential and commercial real estate businesses) haven't been made public. The court's decision is a major setback for Trump, who denies wrongdoing. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Catch up quick</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">August 2019:</strong> Vance hits Trump's accountant with a grand jury subpoena for tax returns and other documents, but Trump sues to block their release, arguing that as sitting president he's immune to criminal investigations. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">July 2020: </strong>The Supreme Court <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/02/22/970134628/supreme-court-paves-way-for-ny-grand-jury-to-get-trump-financial-records?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rejects</a> that premise, so Trump tries arguing that the case is too broad and politically motivated.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">October 2020: </strong>After an appeals court denies <em>that</em> premise, Trump's lawyers take it back to the Supreme Court and the subpoena is put on hold. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now, Vance can <a href="https://apnews.com/article/supreme-court-donald-trump-tax-rercords-3aee14146906351ee9dd34aa7b6f4386?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">collect</a> Trump's records to determine whether his businesses committed fraud, particularly, whether they manipulated the valuations of NY properties to receive favorable loans and reduce property taxes.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>This criminal probe is the "gravest legal threat" Trump has faced, Politico reports. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/22/cherokee-nation-requests-jeep-drop-cherokee-name?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Jeep Pushed Over Cherokee Name
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/22/cherokee-nation-requests-jeep-drop-cherokee-name" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Jeep Cherokee" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MTQ0L2plZXBfY2hlcm9rZWUucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Jeep</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Chevy Apache, Dodge Dakota, Winnebago...the US auto industry has a long history of using Native American monikers and imagery. But yesterday, the Cherokee Nation said it's had enough. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Chief Chuck Hoskin Jr. requested that Jeep <a href="https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a35568468/cherokee-nation-jeep-stop-using-name/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stop using</a> his tribe's name on its Cherokee and Grand Cherokee SUVs, which together account for more than 40% of the brand's total sales. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Cherokee Nation has criticized the appropriation of Native American culture before, but this is its first official request for change. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Jeep said its vehicle names "celebrate Native American people for their nobility, prowess, and pride." Hoskin disagrees. "The best way to honor us is to learn about our sovereign government, our role in this country, our history, culture, and language and have meaningful dialogue with federally recognized tribes on cultural appropriateness," he told Car and Driver. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> In the last year, amid national conversations around racial justice, Land O'Lakes dropped a Native American woman from its packaging, and Cleveland's MLB team and DC's NFL team are changing their names.</p>

GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>

<small><em>Drew Angerer/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> "My first love in law school was antitrust"—Merrick Garland might have caused a minor earthquake in Silicon Valley during his <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/garland-to-make-case-for-new-era-at-justice-department-11613989802?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">confirmation hearing</a> for attorney general yesterday. The DOJ, which Garland will oversee if he's confirmed, sued Google last fall over anti-competitive practices in search and advertising. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>The top 10 hedge fund managers in the world <a href="https://www.institutionalinvestor.com/article/b1qmsgpxhz0lpt/The-20th-Annual-Rich-List-the-Definitive-Ranking-of-What-Hedge-Fund-Managers-Earned-in-2020?campaign_id=4&emc=edit_dk_20210222&instance_id=27358&nl=dealbook&regi_id=83342785&segment_id=52098&te=1&user_id=6e8f5c5256f51c870f4df90ca819260d&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">earned $20.1 billion</a> last year, according to the annual "Rich List" report from Institutional Investor. That's a 50% increase from 2019.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>We're living in an age of peak advice. (<a href="https://www.newyorker.com/culture/cultural-comment/the-age-of-peak-advice?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The New Yorker</a>)</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LUXURY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/22/lvmh-buys-50-stake-jayzs-champagne-brand?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Empire State of Mind
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Ace of Spades on a drink tray" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MTQyL2FjZV9vZl9zcGFkZXMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Dimitrios Kambouris/Getty Images for Fenty</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, business mogul and rapper Jay-Z <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/22/lvmh-buys-50percent-stake-in-jay-zs-champagne-brand-armand-de-brignac.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sold a 50% stake</a> in his champagne brand, Armand de Brignac, to the wine and spirits division of luxury conglomerate LVMH.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Jay-Z has been in the champagne game since he bought a 50% stake in Armand de Brignac in 2006, using his music videos to introduce the brand to the world. Now, Armand de Brignac, which is better known by its nickname "Ace of Spades," is a force in the alcohol industry, selling more than 500,000 bottles in 2019 at prices ranging from <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/22/style/jay-z-lvmh-ace-of-spades-champagne.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$300 to $64,999</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So why sell? Mostly because LVMH and its wine and spirits division, Moët Hennessy, are really, really big. "What we could bring to the brand, which is already very successful, is the sheer power of our international distribution network," Moët Hennessy CEO Philippe Schaus told CNBC. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>This deal, much like LVMH's partnership with Rihanna's Fenty line and Gucci's collab with the rapper Gucci Mane, shows that luxury and hip-hop can be great partners. "I think that people have come to accept that these two worlds are a natural fit," Jay-Z <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/jay-z-and-lvmh-pop-the-cork-in-champagne-tie-up-11613994900?mod=hp_lista_pos3&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the WSJ</a>.</p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nENTERTAINMENT\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/22/spotify-joins-rest-media-world-focusing-international-expansion?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nGlobal Content Is King\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"International media \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MTQxL2ludGVybmF0aW9uYWxfbWVkaWEuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday at its Stream On event, Spotify said it was launching its service in \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2021/02/22/spotify-to-expand-international-footprint-across-85-new-markets/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e85 new markets\u003c/a\u003e across Asia, Africa, the Caribbean, and beyond. Already the dominant audio player with 340 million active users, the expansion will nearly double Spotify’s global footprint. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eWith Hollywood and NYC churning out cultural hit after cultural hit, the US has historically dominated the music and entertainment industries. But the growing success of international content shows the center of gravity is shifting.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSome examples:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Puerto Rican star Bad Bunny was the most streamed artist on Spotify last year, the French Netflix show \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eLupin \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ewas watched by over 70 million people, and South Korean film \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eParasite \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ebecame the first-ever foreign language film to win Best Picture at the Oscars. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBusinesses are looking for new eyes and ears\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSpotify, which has headquarters in Sweden and the US, joins American media companies in recalibrating growth plans to place a larger emphasis on international markets.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNetflix has invested in international content to differentiate itself in the streaming wars, maintain an upward growth trajectory, and serve something fresh to its American viewers. It’s succeeding on \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/americans-consuming-foreign-entertainment-content-8b793e14-f493-4c13-ba4f-e4bddd7a96e1.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eall fronts\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn Q4 of last year, 7.7 million of Netflix's 8.5 million new subscribers came from international markets. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd in Q3, non-US shows across all streaming services accounted for nearly 30% of demand in the US, according to data provided to Axios from Parrot Analytics.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSpotify has been slower to expand outside the US and Europe because securing music rights is a huge headache, but now it's going all-in on the Netflix model. Yesterday's expansion opened its service up to \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-22/spotify-expands-to-80-new-markets-targeting-1-billion-customers?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e1 billion more people\u003c/a\u003e, which will help power discoverability for new artists, styles, and genres. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\"All this untapped music energy and access to our innovative creator tools will help propel artists to new heights,\" Spotify wrote in a statement. Put another way, a more global user base will help New Music Friday surface the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eLupin\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003es of the music world. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eStreaming companies' efforts to expand internationally mirror the mostly borderless world of social media, where creators on platforms like TikTok can achieve global fame with a single viral video. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2021/02/22/supreme-court-donald-trump-tax-returns-new-york-470826?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblocked\u003c/a\u003e former President Trump from keeping his financial records out of the hands of Manhattan District Attorney Cyrus Vance Jr. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe details of Vance's investigation into alleged tax, insurance, and bank fraud by the Trump Organization (which includes residential and commercial real estate businesses) haven't been made public. The court's decision is a major setback for Trump, who denies wrongdoing. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eCatch up quick\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAugust 2019:\u003c/strong\u003e Vance hits Trump's accountant with a grand jury subpoena for tax returns and other documents, but Trump sues to block their release, arguing that as sitting president he's immune to criminal investigations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eJuly 2020: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Supreme Court \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/02/22/970134628/supreme-court-paves-way-for-ny-grand-jury-to-get-trump-financial-records?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erejects\u003c/a\u003e that premise, so Trump tries arguing that the case is too broad and politically motivated.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOctober 2020: \u003c/strong\u003eAfter an appeals court denies \u003cem\u003ethat\u003c/em\u003e premise, Trump's lawyers take it back to the Supreme Court and the subpoena is put on hold. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow, Vance can \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/supreme-court-donald-trump-tax-rercords-3aee14146906351ee9dd34aa7b6f4386?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecollect\u003c/a\u003e Trump's records to determine whether his businesses committed fraud, particularly, whether they manipulated the valuations of NY properties to receive favorable loans and reduce property taxes.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThis criminal probe is the \"gravest legal threat\" Trump has faced, Politico reports. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eChevy Apache, Dodge Dakota, Winnebago...the US auto industry has a long history of using Native American monikers and imagery. But yesterday, the Cherokee Nation said it's had enough. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eChief Chuck Hoskin Jr. requested that Jeep \u003ca href=\"https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a35568468/cherokee-nation-jeep-stop-using-name/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estop using\u003c/a\u003e his tribe's name on its Cherokee and Grand Cherokee SUVs, which together account for more than 40% of the brand's total sales. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Cherokee Nation has criticized the appropriation of Native American culture before, but this is its first official request for change. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJeep said its vehicle names \"celebrate Native American people for their nobility, prowess, and pride.\" Hoskin disagrees. \"The best way to honor us is to learn about our sovereign government, our role in this country, our history, culture, and language and have meaningful dialogue with federally recognized tribes on cultural appropriateness,\" he told Car and Driver. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, business mogul and rapper Jay-Z \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/22/lvmh-buys-50percent-stake-in-jay-zs-champagne-brand-armand-de-brignac.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esold a 50% stake\u003c/a\u003e in his champagne brand, Armand de Brignac, to the wine and spirits division of luxury conglomerate LVMH.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eJay-Z has been in the champagne game since he bought a 50% stake in Armand de Brignac in 2006, using his music videos to introduce the brand to the world. Now, Armand de Brignac, which is better known by its nickname \"Ace of Spades,\" is a force in the alcohol industry, selling more than 500,000 bottles in 2019 at prices ranging from \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/22/style/jay-z-lvmh-ace-of-spades-champagne.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$300 to $64,999\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo why sell? Mostly because LVMH and its wine and spirits division, Moët Hennessy, are really, really big. \"What we could bring to the brand, which is already very successful, is the sheer power of our international distribution network,\" Moët Hennessy CEO Philippe Schaus told CNBC. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThis deal, much like LVMH's partnership with Rihanna's Fenty line and Gucci's collab with the rapper Gucci Mane, shows that luxury and hip-hop can be great partners. \"I think that people have come to accept that these two worlds are a natural fit,\" Jay-Z \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/jay-z-and-lvmh-pop-the-cork-in-champagne-tie-up-11613994900?mod=hp_lista_pos3\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\"
